revision.text:
{{Use American English|date=September 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2012}} {{Infobox military unit |unit_name= 327th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron <center>[[File:Airdefensecommand-logo.jpg|60px]]</center> |image=[[File:327th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron Convair F-102A-75-CO Delta Daggers.jpg|290px]] |caption=Squadron [[F-102A Delta Dagger]]s at Thule AB in 1958<ref group=note>Convair F-102A-75-CO. Serial 56-1429 retired to [[Military Aircraft Storage and Disposition Center]] 2 April 1970, 56-1361 retired on 2 Jun 1971, 56-1368 put on static display at [[Evergreen Aviation and Space Museum]] in [[McMinnville, Oregon]]</ref> |dates= 1942â€“1944; 1955-1960 |country={{flag|United States|23px}} |allegiance= |branch={{air force|USA}} |type= |role=[[air defense]] |size= |command_structure= |current_commander= |garrison= |ceremonial_chief= |colonel_of_the_regiment= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |battles= |notable_commanders= |anniversaries= |decorations= |battle_honours= <!-- Insignia --> |identification_symbol=[[File:327th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron - Emblem.jpg|165px]] |identification_symbol_label=327th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron emblem <small>(approved 14 October 1942)</small><ref name=Maurer327FS>Maurer, ''Combat Squadrons'', pp. 403-404</ref> |identification_symbol_2= |identification_symbol_2_label= }}
The '''327th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron''' is an inactive [[United States Air Force]] unit. Its last assignment was with the [[64th Air Division]] at [[Thule Air Base]], Greenland, where it was inactivated on 25 March 1960.
The [[squadron (aviation)|squadron]] was first active during [[World War II]] as a training unit. It was disbanded in 1944 when the [[Army Air Forces]] reorganized its training and support units in the United States.
The squadron was again activated in August 1955 at [[George Air Force Base]], California. There, it became the first operational squadron to fly the [[Convair F-102 Delta Dagger]]. In 1958 it moved to Thule, where it replaced a unit flying older [[Northrop F-89 Scorpion]]s.
==History==
===World War II=== The [[squadron (aviation)|squadron]] was first activated at [[Hamilton Air Force Base|Hamilton Field]], California in July 1942 as the '''327th Fighter Squadron''', one of the original squadrons of the [[328th Fighter Group]].<ref name=Maurer327FS/><ref name=Maurer328FG>Maurer, ''Combat Units'', pp. 209-210</ref> The squadron initially participated in [[air defense]] of the Pacific coast from Hamilton and later from [[San Francisco International Airport|Mills Field]]. It also served as an Operational Training Unit (OTU).<ref name=Maurer327FS/> The OTU program involved the use of an oversized parent unit to provide [[en cadre|cadres]] to "satellite groups".<ref name=Craven>Craven, & Cate, Vol. VI, Men & Planes, Introduction, p. xxxvi</ref> On 1 March 1943, the squadron mission changed to operating a [[Bell P-39 Airacobra]] Replacement Training Unit (RTU). Replacement Training Units were also oversized units, but they trained [[aircrew]]s prior to their deployment to combat theaters.<ref name=Maurer327FS/><ref name=Craven/>
In February 1944, the 327th moved to [[Marysville Army Air Field]], where it continued as a P-39 RTU.<ref name=Maurer327FS/> However, the [[Army Air Forces]] found that standard military units, based on relatively inflexible tables of organization, were proving less well adapted to the training mission. Accordingly, it adopted a more functional system in which each base was organized into a separate numbered unit, while the groups and squadrons acting as RTUs were disbanded or inactivated.<ref>Maurer, ''Combat Units'', p. 7</ref><ref>Goss, p. 75</ref> This resulted in the 327th, along with other units at Marysville, being disbanded in the spring of 1944<ref name=Maurer327FS/> and being replaced by the 433d AAF Base Unit (Fighter Replacement Training Unit, Single Engine), which assumed the squadron's mission, personnel, and equipment.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.airforcehistoryindex.org/data/000/175/150.xml |title=Abstract, History Marysville Army Air Field, CA April 1944|date=|publisher=Air Force History Index|deadurl=no |accessdate=30 September 2014}}</ref>
===Cold War air defense=== [[File:F-102-327thfis-george.jpg|thumb|right|F-102A of the 327 FIS at George AFB<ref group=note>Convair F-102A-30-CO Delta Dagger serial 54-1396. Note the short vertical stabilizer of early model F-102s.</ref>]] The squadron was again activated as the '''327th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron''' at [[George Air Force Base]], California in August 1955.<ref name=Maurer327FS/> At George, the squadron was initially equipped with [[radar]] equipped and [[Folding-Fin Aerial Rocket|Mighty Mouse rocket]] armed [[North American F-86D Sabre]]s.<ref name=CJ126>Cornett & Johnson, p. 136</ref> These aircraft had been used at George by the [[94th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron]], which moved from George to [[Selfridge Air Force Base]] as part of [[Air Defense Command]] (ADC)'s Project Arrow, which was designed to bring back on the active list the fighter units which had compiled memorable records in the two world wars and unite them with their traditional groups.<ref>Buss, Sturm, Volan, & McMullen, p. 6</ref>
In April 1956, the 327th was the first ADC squadron to fly the [[Convair F-102A Delta Dagger]] in operational service, and became the first supersonic unit in Air Defense Command. These aircraft were also equipped with [[data link]], which enabled them to interface directly with the [[Semi Automatic Ground Environment]] computers in ground direction centers, removing the need for voice communications by air to ground radions.<ref name=CJ126/>
The squadron moved to [[Thule Air Base]], Greenland in July 1958, assuming the [[air defense]] role there from the [[Northrop F-89 Scorpion]]s of the [[74th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron]].<ref name=Maurer327FS/><ref>Maurer, ''Combat Squadrons'', pp. 271-272</ref> The squadron was inactivated there on 25 March 1960, but the Thule air defense mission was resumed within six weeks by the [[332d Fighter-Interceptor Squadron]].<ref name=Maurer327FS/><ref>Cornett & Johnson, p. 127</ref>
==Lineage== * Constituted as the '''327th Fighter Squadron''' on 24 June 1942 : Activated on 10 July 1942 : Disbanded on 31 March 1944 * Reconstituted and redesignated '''327th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron''' on 20 June 1955 : Activated on 18 August 1955 : Discontinued on 25 March 1960<ref name=Maurer327FS/>
===Assignments=== * 328th Fighter Group, 10 July 1942 â€“ 31 March 1944 * [[27th Air Division]], 18 August 1955 * [[4722d Air Defense Group]], 1 December 1956 * 27th Air Division, 25 June 1958 * [[64th Air Division]], 3 July 1958 â€“ 25 March 1960<ref name=Maurer327FS/>
===Stations=== * Hamilton Field, California, 10 July 1942 * Mills Field, California, 5 October 1942 * Marysville Army Air Field, California, 1 February â€“ 31 March 1944 * George Air Force Base, California, 18 August 1955 * Thule Air Base, Greenland, 3 July 1958 â€“ 25 March 1960<ref name=Maurer327FS/>
===Aircraft=== * Bell P-39 Airacobra, 1942â€“1944 * North American F-86D Sabre, 1955â€“1956 * Convair F-102 Delta Dagger, 1956â€“1960<ref name=Maurer327FS/>
===Service streamers===
{| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#efefef;" ! Service Streamer ! Campaign ! Dates ! Notes |- |[[File:Streamer AC.PNG|200px]] ||American Theater without inscription||10 July 1942 â€“ 31 March 1944||327th Fighter Squadron<ref name=Maurer327FS/> |}
